subject: Re: [junit] How to enable/disable JUnit tests programatically ?
msgSnippet: Morten, Does this work for you? import static org.junit.Assume.assumeTrue; @Test public void doSomeOnlineStuff() { assumeTrue(currentlyOnline()); // ... rest
messageBody:
Morten,

Does this work for you?

import static org.junit.Assume.assumeTrue;

@Test public void doSomeOnlineStuff() {
assumeTrue(currentlyOnline());
// ... rest of test
}

This will short-circuit ignore the test if currentlyOnline() is false.
The implementation of currentlyOnline is up to you.

David Saff

On Tue, May 26, 2009 at 4:27 PM, mortench2004 <mortench2004@...> wrote:
> I am using JUnit 4.6 with ANT. I would like to filter out some tests at runtime if the running machine is not online. And to avoid, tight coupling I would like to avoid to hardcode in the ANT file which tests to enable/disable.
>
> Ideally I would like to define a custom attribute to my tests such as @RequireOnline and configure all the Junit runners (incl Parameterized) to filter out these tests based on my custom meta data on the test and the online/offline-state calculated at runtime.
>
> Is something like this possible?
>
> Thanks,
> Morten
